title: Scout and FB Moderno from Font Bureau
content:
Submitted by [paul d hunt](http://web.archive.org/web/20080412130244/http:/www.typophile.com/user/7006 "View user profile.") : 6.Mar.2008 5.13pm 

Font Bureau is excited to announce the release of two major new  
typefaces from our drawing studio - Scout and FB Moderno.

SCOUT

A fresh new sans serif, something always useful, Scout (and a  
related logotype) was drawn by Cyrus Highsmith, a senior type  
designer at Font Bureau, for Geraldine Hessler’s 2006 redesign  
of Entertainment Weekly. The 24 style family marks the magazine’s  
first significant typographic update in a decade. Scout created  
a new typographic identity for the magazine with a design that  
derives structural elements from both new and old: DIN, Venus,  
and Cairoli (a quirky and forgotten Aldo Novarese typeface).

24 Styles: thin, extra light, light, regular, bold, and black  
with italics in normal and condensed widths.

Explore Scout on our website at:  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/Scout](http://web.archive.org/web/20080412130244/http:/www.fontbureau.com/Scout "http://www.fontbureau.com/Scout")

Available from Font Bureau and its distributors.

To find out more about the type designer, Cyrus Highsmith, go to:  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/people/CyrusHighsmith](http://web.archive.org/web/20080412130244/http:/www.fontbureau.com/people/CyrusHighsmith "http://www.fontbureau.com/people/CyrusHighsmith")

FB MODERNO

Intended for display use in print publications, David Berlow  
conceived FB Moderno as a relative of Giza, our famous slab serif.  
He used Apple’s (later abandoned) GX technology to interpolate  
between two 19th century serif styles, a “slab” and a “modern” -  
a type design first!

After being adopted by Eduardo Danilo for the design of Reforma  
in Mexico City (1993), and then Roger Black’s redesign of the  
Baltimore Sun (1994-95), and by Esquire magazine, the Montreal  
Gazette expanded the family under Louise Vincent. Cases i Associats  
added even more weights for La Stampa in Turin.

David has now aligned the weights and widths to make a super 32  
style family, in much the same manner he tamed Bureau Grot to  
make a wide mix of styles. This is a classic (actually neo-classical)  
Font Bureau tale of custom font development. The result, we offer  
a complete 21st Century Modern Family to you: FB Moderno (Modern is  
the traditional name for Bodoni-like typefaces that have a lot of  
contrast between thicks and thins).

32 Styles: light, regular, semibold, and bold in normal, condensed,  
extra condensed, and compressed widths. All with italics.

Come see FB Moderno on our website at:  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/ModernoFB](http://web.archive.org/web/20080412130244/http:/www.fontbureau.com/ModernoFB "http://www.fontbureau.com/ModernoFB")

Available from Font Bureau and its distributors.

To find out more about the type designer, David Berlow, go to:  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/people/DavidBerlow](http://web.archive.org/web/20080412130244/http:/www.fontbureau.com/people/DavidBerlow "http://www.fontbureau.com/people/DavidBerlow")

NEWS

Benton Modern Expansion  
New styles have been added to this great news text type from our  
Readability Series, including Bold, Italic, and Small Caps for Roman,  
Italic and Bold, all in four grades.  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/BentonModern](http://web.archive.org/web/20080412130244/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/BentonModern "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/BentonModern")

Type 101  
Check out Font Bureau’s blog, where we share occasional notes  
about type and typography. Our recent posts include “Sam Berlow  
interviewed on NPR’s On The Media”, “Campaign Typography” and  
“The Em”.  
 [http://type101.fontbureau.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080412130244/http:/type101.fontbureau.com/ "http://type101.fontbureau.com/")

SND Boston  
The 29th annual workshop and exhibition of Society for News Design  
was held this past October in Boston. Font Bureau was a proud  
sponsor of the event. David Berlow gave a talk on “Screen Fonts:  
An Abbr. Hist.” and Matthew Carter’s “It’s The Little Things”  
discussed recent innovations in presenting stock tables, sports  
agate, and other small information. Both were invited to lead the  
Typography Roundtable, a discussion on trends from readability  
to revivals.

TYPO Berlin  
David Berlow has been invited to speak at the 13th international  
design conference of TYPO Berlin, to be held this May. It has  
established itself as the premier European event for typographers,  
graphic designers and other design professionals from all over  
the world.

Cyrus Highsmith featured in Cap&Design  
The Swedish design publication Cap&Design interviewed Font Bureau’s  
senior type designer Cyrus Highsmith, featuring him on the cover  
and inside spread of its October issue. Boomer, Highsmith’s  
original typeface drawn for AARP The Magazine in 2006, was also  
used for that issue.

Helvetica: A Documentary Film by Gary Hustwit  
Released in 2007 Helvetica is an independent film “about typography,  
graphic design and global visual culture…the proliferation of  
one typeface as part of a larger conversation about the way type  
affects of lives.” Matthew Carter and Mike Parker, distinguished  
members of Font Bureau’s type board, were interviewed for the film,  
as well as a Font Bureau contributing type designer, Tobias  
Frere-Jones. After showing in over 150 film festivals worldwide,  
its global screening tour continues and is now available on DVD.  
It was nominated for the Independent Spirit Award and recognized  
by the Design Museum in London.  
 [http://www.helveticafilm.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080412130244/http:/www.helveticafilm.com/ "http://www.helveticafilm.com/")

NOTEWORTHY

Font Bureau contributing type designer Christian Schwartz was  
awarded the eighth Prix Charles Peignot by Association Typographique  
Internationale (AtypI) this past September.  
 [http://www.atypi.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080412130244/http:/www.atypi.org/ "http://www.atypi.org/")

Matthew Carter acted as Jury Chair of TDC2 2008, the Type Director’s  
Club annual international competition of new typeface designs.  
 [http://www.tdc.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080412130244/http:/www.tdc.org/ "http://www.tdc.org/")

STAY TUNED

Our next upcoming releases will include two new serif displays,  
Benton Modern Display, prepared by Dyana Weissman and Richard Lipton,  
and Rocky, crafted by Matthew Carter.
